did.unittitle: IBT Training and Development Department records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: International Brotherhood of Teamsters, Chauffeurs, Warehousemen, and Helpers of America

did.abstract: This collections contains the records of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters Training & Development department dating from 1986-2009.
did.physloc: Materials may be stored off-site, and may require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into 3 series: Departmental Records, Teamsters Leadership Academy, and Stewards Training Publications and Seminar Materials. Files are organized in the order in which they were recieved.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The IBT Training & Development Department was formed in 2005 as part of an organization-wide restructuring. Its predecessor was the Education Department established in 1982. From 1978 to 1982 training was undertaken by the Research and Education Department. The Training & Development Department designs programs and materials to train IBT officers, staff, stewards and members in a variety of areas of labor relations. The department sponsors the Teamster Leadership Academy which provides training in collective bargaining, organizing, political action and union administration.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, 2012 [2012.007]

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains meeting minutes, subject files, programs, brochures, photographs, and reports of the Training and Development Division of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, previously known as the Education Department. The material dates from 1986-2009. These are the records of the Training and Development Division after the restructuring of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, as well as photographs and event materials dated previous to that restructuring.

The Training and Development Division is primarily responsible for education local unions and their leaders on such matters as: union administration, collective bargaining, membership mobilization, effective communications, and leadership.

controlaccess.subject: Labor unions -- United States -- History -- 20th century
Labor unions
Labor

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains administrative files, event planning records, correspondence, partnerships, and programs administered by the Training and Development Division. These materials are dated from 2004 to 2008.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into 3 subseries: Records, Events, and Photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains administrative files, case studies, programs, handouts, agendas, conference materials, and photographs. These materials are dated from 1986 to 2009. The Teamsters Leadership Academy is a leadership program that was established in 1986 to provide Local Union leaders with the information and skills they need to address an ever-changing workplace and labor relations environment. The Teamsters Leadership Academy is held both in Washington, D.C. and in the regions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes printed flyers and worksheets, administrative files, case studies, and subject files pertaining to the administration of the Teamsters Leadership Academy. The materials are dated from 1998 to 2005.

did.unittitle: Easyinfo.leader; a CD for Teamster Officers and Business Representatives
Miscellanous-Sally Payne Seminars & Teamsters Leadership Academy Agendas
"The Teamster Story: A History Worth Preserving" Agenda & History Packet

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials of this series include planning documents, brochures, agendas, and conference packets. They range in date from 1986 to 2000, and offer a glimpse into the nature of events organized as part of the Teamsters Leadership Academy program during that time.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes photographic materials taken during the course of Teamsters Leadership Academy events throughout the country. This material is dated from 1993 to 2009 and includes significant undated and unidentified material.
